subject: Same Old Jets
event:
To be a Jets fan is to understand the meaning of pain.

It is, admittedly, a different sort of pain than that known by Lions fans, but no less sharp.  The Jets like to tease you with false hope, so the eventual defeat will cut deeper.

It is all Joe Willie's fault.  As every true Jets fan knows, he made a deal with the devil to win SuperBowl III.  So long as any Jets fan who saw that victory remains alive, the Jets will never win again.

Sigh.

(I won't talk about the Giants this week.  The game meant everything to the Vikings and nothing to the G-Men.  I was heartened to catch glimpses of Danny Ware and Mario Manningham, however.  Both showed flashes, and David Carr did well enough as well, though Ghu Forbid that we ever actually need him).

One consolation for Jets fans.   At least they're not the Cowboys.

comments.article:
If I had to put blame, I'd put it on the organization for taking a QB that was on his last leg (although he did ok last season, look at the seasons before that) and let him throw a zillion interceptions to lead them to where...nowhere.

He had 3 more picks today.

Shameful.

And it was nice to see Chad get some revenge.
comments.subject: Jets

comments.article:
George:

Perhaps instead of lamenting the Jets' collapse, you can be happy for your boy Chad Pennington. There's a karmic beauty in his having been the agent of demise for the team that cast a good QB aside for a fading star with an ego the size of Paul Prudhomme.
comments.subject: Same old Jets

comments.article: Agreed!
comments.subject: Re: Same old Jets

comments.article:
One consolation for Jets fans. At least they're not the Cowboys.

True and honestly they weren't playing for anything today. If they lost the Dolphins go on and if they won then the Pats. But they did try their hardest.

I do think we have seen Farve's last pass.

If Favre does indeed retire, the Jets are truly screwed.

Chad will be leading the Dolphins for another decade, beating us twice a year. The Pats will eventually get Brady back. Even the Bills have Trent Edwards, who looks like an up-and-comer.

Who will the Jets have? Kellen Clemens. Based on present evidence, he'll be far and away the weakest QB in the division.

(And no, I'm not in favor of going after Matt Cassell either. Sure, he's looked good so far, but these things can be deceiving. Anyone remember Scott Mitchell?)
comments.subject: QB of the future

comments.article: I hate to say it, but I agree with the above posters, they bargained for a one year shot by picking up favre knowing he was maybe good for a season and casting off their good young qb.  Thats a deal that will screw them over for at least next season, if not quite a few more.  Ah well, who am I to judge, I am a seattle sports fan after all...
comments.subject: hmm

comments.article: Every time I feel depressed about being a Minnesota fan, I thank God I am not a Seattle fan.  They're the only place that I think is truly more tormented.
comments.subject: Re: hmm

comments.upictitle: peace now, freedom now, equality now.: ai // she's a rebel.
comments.article: At least they're not the Cowboys... or the Chiefs. Cringe.

Or, heaven forbid, the Lions.

-Wasta

Barring a remarkable turnaround, I think Bronco fans will join Jets and Dallas fans in the usual end of the season misery that is part of life in the NFL.

Please Broncos, play defense!

The Jets like to tease you with false hope, so the eventual defeat will cut deeper.

That's Boston sports in a nutshell right there. ;)
I would have to say that the 49ers will win the NFC Worst next year.  Mike Singletary will have that team turned around and believing in itself.  I'd expect them to go 10-6 or 11-5 next season.

Not gloating, no, no, but I was greatly relieved when Favre overthrew his receiver for an INT with 5 minutes left, only one TD down, and they were driving down the field. Sorry for you but happy for me: after a 1-15 season, it's been nice to see some competence. I have my doubts about how far we'll get in the playoffs but long-suffering Dolphins fans finally have something to cheer about for a change. And I have to admit that even if they were not my team, I always am happy when good players who are dropped come back to thumb their noses at the team that cut them loose.

Hope your Giants will console you in the playoffs!

"I have my doubts about how far we'll get in the playoffs but long-suffering Dolphins fans finally have something to cheer about for a change."

Hear hear! It's a shame for Favre that he padded his "Most Career Interceptions" record this game (did he end up with as many INTs as TDs for this season?), but every one of them was sweet from my perspective.

And Pennington? Yeah, he's doing very well. Thanks you, Jets, for cutting him loose. ;)
I loved your dig at Dallas. They were pathetic.

Out of curiosity, if the Jets do win big sometime over the next couple years, will 'Song of Ice and Fire' have a happy ending?

;)

The Cowboys-Eagles game was a sick nightmare. The Cowboys didn't deserve to win, and they didn't deserve to go to the playoffs, not playing high school football like that. I'll say due justice was done this time; if they don't show up to play, they don't get to.

Next season.

I was glad to see Dallas lose...then again, I was glad to see the Bucs lose as well.  Both of those teams were going downhill to finish the season.  I would rather see a team that's moving up thru the season like the Eagles get there...a team with forward momentum, not backward.
comments.subject: Cowgirls

comments.article:
There is nothing more frustrating (as a patriots fans) than watching an incompetent team team like the Jets lose to a mediocre team like the Dolphins. I'm done watching football this year. The Patriots had too many injuries and blew some key games, but those last place schedules the Jets and the fins were playing didn't help matters either....

I'll get over this in a few days but there's nothing like having to root for your most hated rival only to have them gag when counts...I don't know maybe taking the Patriots down with them takes the edge off for you Jet fans. Ultimately the Patriots made their own bed and all of us Bostonians have to sleep in it...Doh!

By the way Happy new year to you and yours Mr. Martin.
comments.subject: I hate the Jets...and Brett Farve Stinks..

comments.article: I think it's great...Dolphins win and knock the Jets AND the Pats out...schedule or not, maybe the Pats should have won more games with their beloved Cassell this year. :)
comments.subject: Re: I hate the Jets...and Brett Farve Stinks..
Re: I hate the Jets...and Brett Farve Stinks..
Re: I hate the Jets...and Brett Farve Stinks..
Re: The Pats got screwed, no ifs, ands, or buts
Re: The Pats got screwed, no ifs, ands, or buts
Re: The Pats got screwed, no ifs, ands, or buts

comments.article: at least your team isnt 0-16. go lions!
I'm just happy the Vikings were able to win and get into the post season.
comments.subject: Go Vikes!

comments.article:
To be a Bears fan is to understand the meaning of pain.

It is, admittedly, a different sort of pain than that known by Lions fans, but no less sharp. The Bears like to tease you with false hope, so the eventual defeat will cut deeper.

:(

I feel your pain. I stopped watching after the Dolphs scored two touchdowns in 15 seconds. Seeing that monstrous, lumbering tackle or lineman or whatever the hell he was--I was struck blind and temporarily blacked out; I might even have died just for a moment or two--going over the goal line over and over and over again was too much. Just too much.
F NY.  Gnats are gonna choke.
comments.subject: HA HA

comments.article: How could the Jets let the Patriots down like that!!! :/ (hehe)  And yeah, the Cowboys... yikes.  _Jason Witten_ was throwing the ball better than Romo!
comments.subject: So close

comments.article: Look at the bright side, Jets kept Belichek and the Pats out of the playoffs, at least.

Pain is losing to the RAIDERS and then watching Philly blow out Dallas, which would have guaranteed a certain craptastic team a ticket to the playoffs.

Pain is watching a two entirely different teams play the Super Bowl in your stadium while you wile away the post season wondering if it is at all possible for you to NOT SUCK ANY WORSE THAN YOU DID.

Ahem.

Good luck to your Giants and may Favre only go in and out of retirement six or seven times for your Jets.

:)
comments.subject: "You don't know what pain is! "  --Buffalo Bill

comments.article:
Only 6 or 7 more retirements? Haha...that's priceless.

He's the Jets problem now.
comments.subject: Re: "You don't know what pain is! "  --Buffalo Bill

comments.article: It could be worse. You could be a Bears fan and a Cubs fan.
Yeah. I imagine being a Jets fan is like being a Bills fan. It is all I can do to kill myself.
I wasn't gone for dead, just nothing good to talk about, until now!!!
comments.subject: we're baaaack

comments.article: Nice to see the teams that finished strong get in...Chargers and Eagles. And the teams finishing poor not making it..Bucs and Cowboys.
comments.subject: Re: we're baaaack

comments.article:
Bite your tongue! Joe is a saint in this town. He could and can do no wrong. Sober or drunk.

At least they showed up to play. Now, whether or not they did enough for Mangini to keep his job... We know much of the coaching staff will likely be gone. I'm really interested in seeing if Brett will be back. I'll bet yes. Or, no.

The Giants subs were pretty good. They held their own against the Vikes. Since there's no Giants game next weekend here's some LT (the original) to listen to. http://www.wfan.com/topic/play_window.php?audioType=Episode&audioId=3195624
